data.title: Konami and Hudson Soft Together
data.meta_description: Konami, one of the major players in the gaming industry, and Hudson …
data.text:
Konami, one of the major players in the gaming industry, and Hudson Soft, one of the oldest name in the gaming industry, jointly announced today plans to enter into a strategic business alliance. According to the press release, Konami Computer Entertainment Studio (Sapporo) will be absorbed by Hudson Soft. In return, Konami will receive 45% of Hudson Soft's stocks through third-party allotment of shares, making Konami that largest single shareholder of Hudson Soft.

The agreement will allow Konami's name to be linked to one of the oldest names in the game entertainment industry, as well as support in developing contents for the rising cellphone gaming market. Not to mention, Konami will gain access to Hudson's know-how in developing multiplayer games like Mario Party. As for Hudson Soft, they will gain usage rights to Konami's Shanghai studio for future game, in addition for distribution through Konami's game distribution network.

In a statement by the CEO of Konami, Kagemasa Kouzuki, Japanese gaming industry is entering a new age where within a few years, the industry will be dominated by two or three companies. Combine this partnership with Hudson Soft and Konami's recent investments in Success (publisher of Tony Hawk Pro Skater in Japan) and PEOPLE (one of Japan's top fitness clubs), Konami has strengthened their position inthe gaming industry.
